items.title: Precision Link Conveyor Is Fast, Accurate
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)

items.title: Toyota Ranks No. 1 Among Automotive Suppliers
items.author: Jennifer Pierce
items.summary:
- *Toyota*, *Honda*, and *General Motors* lead the automotive industry as the most favorable OEMs according to a recent study by Plante Moran.
- Despite challenges such as material costs and declining demand for electric vehicles, five out of six OEMs showed improved supplier relations.
- The ranking emphasizes ongoing efforts by manufacturers to strengthen partnerships amidst industry tensions.

items.title: Lean Manufacturing Products
COVAL Vacuum Technology, Inc.
items.summary:
- COVAL is a leader in *vacuum automation solutions* across various industries. 
- They specialize in high-performance *suction cups*, vacuum generators, and robotic grippers designed for efficiency. 
- COVAL's products enhance productivity and support *sustainable operations* in automation systems.

items.title: BalTec Corp Overview
items.summary:
- BalTec Group specializes in *joining technology machinery*, focusing on *radial riveting*, *orbital riveting*, and *roller forming*.
- Established in 1968, BalTec has become a **global leader** with over 70 employees and 40 sales partners worldwide.
- They also offer **custom turnkey work cells** to address clients' specific integration needs.

items.title: Cobot Boosts Productivity at Contract Manufacturer
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- Action Plastics enhanced productivity by introducing a *cobot*, specifically the OB7, to automate repetitive tasks.
- The cobot significantly improved *quality control* in assembly processes for customers, ensuring consistent results and optimizing throughput.
- This automation allows employees to focus on more skilled tasks, reshaping the workplace into a more *dynamic* environment.

items.title: GM Profit Falls Amid Tariff Costs Despite EV Gains
items.summary:
- GM's profit dropped by **34%** in Q2 due to over **$1 billion** in tariff costs.  
- Despite challenges, **EV sales more than doubled**, with GM capturing **16%** of the U.S. EV market.  
- The company plans to invest **$4 billion** in U.S. production while also facing pressure from **domestic and international** competition.

items.title: Vision Systems Automate Inspection of EV Components
items.summary:
- *BorgWarner* leverages advanced machine vision technology for *precision assembly* and inspection of EV components.
- Automated inspection processes enhance quality control, delegating human effort more efficiently.
- The *Cognex 3D vision system* significantly improves defect detection and is crucial for maintaining safety standards in EV manufacturing.

items.title: Modular Automated Cell Assembles Medical Devices
items.summary:
- **Mikron Automation** has launched a modular, *semiautomatic assembly cell* for medical devices.
- This scalable system allows for rapid deployment with low investment, functioning effectively in an *ISO 7 clean room*.
- Up to **12 cells** can be linked for increased production capacity, running at rates of *up to 5 cycles per minute*.

items.title: Pratt & Whitney Celebrates 100 Years
items.summary:
- *Pratt & Whitney* marks a century of innovation in the *aerospace industry*, having introduced significant technologies like the *R-1340 Wasp engine*.
- The company continues to lead with its *GTFâ¢ engines* and the *F135 engine* for the F-35, emphasizing efficiency and safety.
- Celebratory events include a *global exhibit* at 11 sites and a historical marker at its original headquarters in *Hartford, Connecticut*.

items.title: New Silicone Bonding Method Could Strengthen Soft Robots and Medical Devices
items.summary:
- Research from the University of HawaiÊ»i has developed a method to enhance *silicone elastomers*, crucial for soft medical devices and robotics.
- By controlling *curing time and temperature*, the bonding strength of silicone layers can be significantly improved, achieving a 50% increase in flexibility.
- This approach is *simple and scalable*, promising advancements in *healthcare, robotics*, and *consumer technology*.

items.title: Mechanic Finds Missing Wallet of Retired Ford Worker
items.summary:
- Mechanic Chad Volk discovered a *missing wallet* while repairing a 2015 Ford Edge in Minnesota.
- The wallet belonged to *Richard Guilford*, a retired Ford worker who lost it 11 years ago during a night shift.
- Thanks to social media, Richard was reunited with his wallet, finding everything intact, including cash and gift cards.

items.title: CNH Enhances Ergonomics With AI Technology
items.summary:
* CNH is leveraging *AI technology* to improve workplace ergonomics at its assembly plants in Brazil and Canada. 
* The Kinebot software has significantly reduced the time for ergonomic analysis from three hours to just 30 minutes, resulting in a 75% reduction in analysis time. 
* Employee absences due to orthopedic issues have decreased by around 200 days annually, enhancing workplace safety and efficiency.

items.title: GE Aerospace Soars to 25-Year Stock High After Record-Breaking Earnings
items.summary:
- GE Aerospace's stock reached a *25-year high* after *record-breaking* earnings.  
 - The company reported a *21.2% increase* in revenue to $11.02 billion due to boosted jet engine deliveries.  
 - GE raised its forecast for 2025, anticipating adjusted earnings per share between *$5.60 and $5.80*, amid ongoing supply chain improvements.

items.title: New Fasteners Solve Unique Challenges
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- *Fasteners* are specialized for distinct materials and applications, including tamper-proof designs. 
- The **Ghost fastening system** enables secure yet disassemblable metal assemblies with concealed fasteners.
- Innovations like *ALtracs Xt thread-forming screws* and *E-Z Sonic inserts* enhance strength and efficiency in diverse materials including plastics and light alloys.

items.title: Japanâs Car Industry Has Highest Robot Installations in Five Years
items.summary:
- The Japanese automotive industry saw a *13,000 industrial robot* installation in 2024, marking an *11% increase* from the previous year.
- Japan holds *38% of global robot production*, ranking fourth globally in factory automation density with *1,531 robots per 10,000 employees*.
- With a shift towards *alternative power trains*, continued investments in robotic technology are expected for battery and hydrogen-fueled vehicles.

items.title: Embraer's CEO Warns Proposed Tariffs Would Make Shipments to U.S. Airlines "Unfeasible"
items.summary:
- **Embraer**'s CEO warned that a proposed 50% tariff on Brazilian exports would severely impact the company's revenue, akin to the effects of the COVID pandemic.
- The tariffs could lead to **order cancellations**, delivery delays, and significant added costs, estimated at **$9 million per jet** exported to the U.S.
- With the U.S. being Embraer's largest market, the company anticipates financial burdens potentially reaching **20 billion reais (~$3.6 billion)** by 2030 if the tariffs are enacted.

items.title: New Process Monitoring System Offers Flexibility
Joby Aviation Expands Manufacturing Facility in California
items.summary:
- Joby Aviation is expanding its manufacturing facility in **Marina, California**, increasing its capacity to produce eVTOL aircraft.  
- The expansion collaborates with Toyota to enhance manufacturing processes, aiming for **FAA certification** and commercial readiness.  
- This initiative is supported by a **$9.8 million grant** and will create hundreds of new jobs in California and Ohio.

items.title: The AI-Driven Shift Toward Adaptive Supply Networks
items.summary:
- The pandemic has shown that *supply chain adaptability* is essential for success. 
- AI tools are transforming supply chain planning, enabling rapid scenario modeling. 
- Companies that prioritize resilience and intelligent networks will outperform competitors in today's volatile environment.

items.title: GM and LG Energy Upgrade Battery Facility in TN
items.summary:
* General Motors and LG Energy Solution plan to upgrade their Spring Hill facility to produce *lithium iron phosphate (LFP)* battery cells by late 2027.
* This transition aims to reduce EV costs and expand battery options, as LFP cells are more affordable than traditional nickel-based batteries.
* The upgrade is expected to boost local job growth and enhance U.S. battery manufacturing leadership.

items.title: GM Idles Silao, Mexico Plant for Several Weeks
items.summary:
- General Motors has paused production at its *Silao, Mexico* plant, affecting *Chevrolet Silverado* and *GMC Sierra* models.
- The plant is down for several weeks, including parts of July and upcoming weeks in August, as part of routine maintenance.
- Despite the downtime, sales for both models remain *strong*, with increases reported in the first half of 2025.

items.title: X-ble Wearable Robot to Support Aerospace Operations
items.summary:
- *Hyundai* and *Kia* have launched the X-ble Shoulder wearable robot for **aerospace operations** at *Korean Air*.
- The robot assists with **overhead tasks**, reducing shoulder strain and boosting workplace efficiency.
- Direct feedback from over 300 workers helped refine the design, with plans for global expansion by **2026**.

items.title: Nissan Delays Launch of Two EVs Amid Declining Demand
items.summary:
- Nissan is delaying two electric crossovers by *10 months* due to *slowing EV demand* in the U.S.
- The delays extend the launch dates to *November 2028* and *March 2029* for Nissan and Infiniti models, respectively.
- This decision follows the end of federal EV tax credits, impacting both *consumer interest* and *automaker strategies*.

items.title: New System Enables Robots to Solve Complex Manipulation Problems
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- MIT and Nvidia's new algorithm allows robots to analyze *thousands* of motion plans at once.
- This method tackles complex manipulation tasks quickly, improving efficiency in *factory settings*.
- The algorithm, called **cuTAMP**, operates without pre-existing training data, making it versatile for various applications.

items.title: GE Appliances Invests $490 Million in Louisville Plant
items.summary:
- GE Appliances will invest *$490 million* to create an advanced assembly line in *Louisville, KY*, generating *800 new jobs*.
- This project is part of a larger *$3.5 billion* investment in U.S. manufacturing and aims to make GE the largest American washer manufacturer.
- The revamped plant will showcase *cutting-edge technology* including automated guided vehicles and will be fully operational by *2027*.

items.title: Chinese Robot Dog Outpaces Boston Dynamicsâ WildCat
items.summary:
- Mirror Me's *Black Panther II* ran 100 meters in **13.17 seconds**, surpassing Boston Dynamics' WildCat. 
- The company, founded in May 2024, aims to lead the *robotics* sector in China and is backing future developments including bipedal robots. 
- Despite this achievement, the Guinness World Record remains held by Koreaâs Hound robot, which completed the distance in **19.87 seconds**.

items.title: Automotive Suppliers Facing Mounting Headwinds
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- *Automotive suppliers* are experiencing increasing pressure due to stagnation in production and rising costs, leading to profitability at just 4.7%.
- The study highlights the challenges of low demand and overcapacity, particularly in Europe, with EV adoption slower than expected.
- Key relationships and much-needed strategic alignment with OEMs can help suppliers manage these risks and uncertainties effectively.

items.title: AIâs Increasing Role in Manufacturing Spurs Call for New Policies
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- *Over 50%* of U.S. manufacturers plan to invest in **AI** over the next two years to enhance innovation and address labor shortages.
- A report indicates that *data quality* and *accessibility* are major barriers to effective **AI** implementation in manufacturing.
- *81%* of manufacturers are accelerating their digital transformation efforts, particularly in **AI**, cybersecurity, and quality management.

items.title: New Technology Enables Better Human-Robot Collaboration
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- The *PARU* system enhances safety with dynamic light curtains around robots, ensuring safer human-robot interactions.
- Advanced cameras and projectors adjust safety zones in real-time, halting robot movements upon detecting human presence.
- This innovative technology aligns economic specifications with safety standards, streamlining *human-robot collaboration* and reducing engineering costs.

items.title: NAM Proposes âManufacturing Investment Acceleratorâ
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- The NAM's new program aims to enhance *domestic manufacturing* investment amid declining manufacturer optimism.
- The proposal includes *duty-free imports* of critical inputs and tariffs rebates for expanding U.S. operations.
- A Quarterly Manufacturing Dialogue is suggested for continuous manufacturer's feedback and program improvement.

items.title: Startup Raises $125M to Bring Robot-Assisted Cataract Surgery to Market
items.summary:
- *ForSight Robotics* is developing a robotic system for cataract surgery, having raised **$125 million** in funding.
- The robot, named *Oryom*, utilizes **microsurgery**, **machine learning**, and **computer vision** and is currently in testing phases.
- With **4 million** cataract surgeries in the U.S. annually, the startup aims to enhance *precision* and *accessibility* in eye care worldwide.

items.title: Laser Stripping of Magnet Wire
items.summary:
- The study compares various *laser technologies* for efficiently stripping enamel from magnet wire before welding.
- *Laser ablation* is identified as the most precise method, crucial for preventing weld defects caused by residual coating.
- The **combination of IR and NIR lasers** showed the best performance with the highest weld strength and lowest presence of carbon residues.

items.title: Auto Parts Assembler Orders 100 Autonomous Mobile Robots
items.summary:
- Melco Mobility Solutions has ordered *100* autonomous mobile robots from **Cartken Inc.** for use in their Japan facilities.
- The *Hauler robot*, designed for interbuilding transport, can carry up to *660 pounds* and navigate various terrains.
- Through Melco, Cartken's robots have become the first to be authorized for **autonomous driving** on public roads in Japan at night.

items.title: Toyota Begins Shipping Batteries from NC Facility
items.summary:
- Toyota's new battery plant in *North Carolina* has started shipping hybrid-electric battery modules.
- Initial shipments target the *Mazda Toyota Manufacturing* plant in Alabama, with future deliveries to *Toyota Kentucky* planned for the hybrid Camry.
- The facility represents a *$13.9 billion investment*, projected to create *5,100 jobs* while focusing on lithium-ion battery production.

items.title: New Process Uses Ultrasound Technology to Test EV Batteries
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- *Engineers at Drexel University* have developed an ultrasound tool to inspect EV batteries for defects. 
- This method offers *faster and cheaper diagnostics* than traditional X-ray techniques. 
- The technology enhances safety by identifying potential *damage* that could lead to battery failures.

items.title: Archerâs Midnight eVTOL Completes First Test Flight in Abu Dhabi
items.summary:
- Archer Aviation has successfully completed the first test flight of its *Midnight* eVTOL in Abu Dhabi, focusing on local environmental challenges.
- This test is a significant milestone for their Launch Edition program, aimed at establishing *air taxi services* in the emirate.
- Ongoing tests will further certification and commercialization, positioning Abu Dhabi as a central hub for *urban air mobility* in the Middle East.

items.title: Robots Coordinate for Aerospace Assembly
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- *Robots are transforming aircraft assembly*, moving from manual processes to automation to address labor shortages and quality control. 
- Canadian systems integrator *Samuel Automation* designed an assembly cell featuring *three Kawasaki robots* for precise nut plate installation. 
- The automated process has reduced cycle time by 26 seconds and decreased operator numbers from three to one, leading to more efficient manufacturing.

items.title: German Start-up Begins Pilot Production of Fuel Cells for Heavy Trucks
items.summary:
- Cellcentric, a joint venture between *Daimler Truck* and *Volvo Group*, has initiated pilot production of **fuel cell systems** for heavy trucks in *Esslingen, Germany*.
- The company aims to achieve large-scale fuel cell production by the end of the decade, promoting **sustainable transportation**.
- Efforts include developing not only fuel cells but also their **recycling and remanufacturing** processes to enhance efficiency and sustainability.

items.title: Cobot Boosts Output by 33 Percent
Whatâs New With Clinching
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary:
- *Clinching* is a versatile joining process for sheet metals, eliminating the need for adhesives or welding.
- New technological advances enable clinching of a broader range of materials and thicknesses, improving efficiency and reducing costs by up to **50%** compared to traditional methods.
- The trend is moving towards automation and integration with robotics, enhancing quality control and adapting to modern manufacturing demands.

items.title: Virtual Reality Helps Stellantis Improve Assembly
items.summary:
- *Stellantis engineers* leverage **virtual reality** to optimize vehicle assembly processes.
- VR tools help identify the best assembly configurations tailored to various *physical requirements*.
- This innovation aims to enhance efficiency and safety in the assembly line before production starts.

items.title: Autocam Medical to Build Assembly Plant in Indiana
items.summary:
- **Autocam Medical** is planning a $70 million assembly plant in Warsaw, Indiana.
- The 100,000-square-foot facility is expected to create up to **300 new jobs** over three to four years.
- The company is a global leader in **precision-machined medical devices**, with existing facilities in several U.S. states and China.

items.title: Robots Automate Assembly of Brake Component
Hyundaiâs Alabama Plant Exported Just 14 Cars in June
A Robot Learns How to Fold Napkins
Valeo to Supply Remanufactured Components to Stellantis
Data Center Manufacturer to Build $300 Million Assembly Plant in Texas
Foxconn May Deploy Humanoid Robots at Texas Assembly Plant
Hyundai Opens a New Assembly Plant
